titles.title: Prison Conversion Enhancement Act of 1987

A bill to amend section 203 of the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 to establish as a priority the conveyance of surplus Federal property for use as correctional facilities to alleviate the shortage of prison space resulting from the increase in drug crime convictions.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Government Efficiency, Federalism.

committee.subcommittee: Government Efficiency, Federalism, and the District of Columbia
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Prison Conversion Enhancement Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 to require, during the two-year period following enactment of this Act, the Administrator of General Services and the Attorney General to provide priority disposition for the conversion of suitable surplus property into correctional facilities. Directs the Attorney General to report to the Congress on the number of surplus properties certified for use as prison facilities. Directs the Administrator to report to the Congress on the number and location of properties which have been converted for use as prisons.
